text: George W. Creamer (1855 – June 27, 1886), born George W. Triebel, was an American Major League Baseball second baseman from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He played with four teams in two leagues: the Milwaukee Grays (), the Syracuse Stars (), the Worcester Ruby Legs (–), and the Pittsburgh Alleghenys (–). On August 20, 1883, after a game between the Louisville Eclipse and the Alleghenys‚ Creamer and fellow players Billy Taylor and Mike Mansell were each fined $100 and suspended indefinitely for drunkenness. In , he briefly managed the Alleghenys for 8 games, but he lost all the games he oversaw. Creamer died of tuberculosis in Philadelphia, where he was interred at Greenwood Cemetery.Philadelphia Death Certificate, retrieved from familysearch.org ==See also== *List of Major League Baseball player-managers ==References== ==External links== Category:1855 births Category:1886 deaths Category:19th- century baseball players Category:Major League Baseball second basemen Category:Baseball players from Pennsylvania Category:Major League Baseball player-managers Category:Milwaukee Grays players Category:Syracuse Stars (NL) players Category:Worcester Ruby Legs players Category:Pittsburgh Alleghenys players Category:Pittsburgh Alleghenys managers Category:Sportspeople from Philadelphia Category:Pittsburgh Allegheny players Category:Rockford White Stockings players Category:Brooklyn Atlantics (minor league) players Category:19th-century deaths from tuberculosis Category:Burials at Greenwood Cemetery, Philadelphia
title: George Creamer
